body:
do i understand you correctly that the php extractor got a problem with the current owncloud .tar.bz2 files?
meaning there's nothing to be done about it, the updater just won't work?

*edit:* thanks for the really quick answer, by the way :)

@randolfcarter according to its description archive_tar doesn't support extended tar typeflags, namely

    xhdtype  'x'            /* extended header referring to the
                                   next file in the archive */

http://www.gnu.org/software/tar/manual/html_node/standard.html

the only solution i see is to rebuild 5.0.13 tar.bz2 package

archive_tar expects '5' or '2' (directory or file) as a typeflag https://github.com/owncloud/3rdparty/blob/master/archive/tar.php#l1664 and treats anything else as a file.

extraction error is caused by the entry with typeflag 'x'
related to https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5732

i wonder if this is the right place to ask - i have the same problem on my owncloud installation - and i don't know how to move on from here? how can i upgrade if this keeps happening?
do i have to do a manual upgrade?
thanks

yeah, if this is just a matter of recompressing the archives, can that please be done?  

i imagine that there are a lot of installations out there like mine to which we don't have shell access (on hosting plans).  and even more of us that wouldn't know how to do the manual upgrade confidently even if we had shell access.  and manually replacing files and replacing configs - all still error prone.  and if there's another way, i haven't seen it documented.

thanks!
@karlitschek what do you think?
any progress on that? would be nice ;-)

something new here? it's very time-consuming to update without shell-access...
thanks!
that's really strange. works just fine for me here.

i also get an error in log

> error | updater | /var/www/folder/phptmp//25e1b6d80bc6cb3ceb9021f325f1224a.tar.bz2 extraction error

could this be related to the broken updater? i had to remove some lines to make the updater work again after 5.0.11 update. https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/4857

@te-online as it is said above:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5795#issuecomment-29131041

this package can not be untared with 3rdparty library used in oc, namely archive_tar pear class.

the steps to reproduce are listed above already:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/issues/5795#issuecomment-28161128

all one needs is to download the package, put it to any location and paste the code snippet inside any oc template.
it would fail on extraction.

it's enough to trace the code to confirm this just as i did.
in the middle of extraction archive_tar returns false here https://github.com/owncloud/3rdparty/blob/master/archive/tar.php#l1664 due to extended typeflag it isn't aware of

okay, unfortunately i don't know much about tar flags or how the updater works.

so without any knowledge i try to ask: what about the idea of @mrmrsk to rebuild the package (with a correct typeflag or none)? any possibility to solve the problem in with this idea? :-)

the question is what the "correct" tar format is here. we switched to format=gnu 2 month ago to fix a problem that some users see paxheader folders in the tar. this seems to happen with old tar implementations. now it seems that other tar versions have problems with the gnu format. can someone a format that works for everyone?

okay, i tried a bit and documented it here in detail - but then hit reload which removed the text from the input... (beginners mistake) - but good for everyone, not so much to read ;-). so short story:
- paxheader folders still appear to me in 7zip (windows 7, 64 bit, 9.20 portable) in the .tar.bz2 file from owncloud.org and could possibly cause problems. 7zip can't extract the file without problems - could also be caused by not updated 7zip on my computer :d
- i tried several "format" options of the tar-command on ubuntu 12.04 on both, the extracted .tar.bz2 data and the .zip data from owncloud.org. none of the files i created could be extracted on the server.
- i found out that even tarballs with just one file return "extraction failed".

**and: i found out (by accident) that tarballs created with 7zip on windows (via gui) containing very long filenames (> 100 characters) can be extracted on the server with no problems!**

but it is not visible for me which flag might be set for long filenames that makes the tar work with the oc-extractor. maybe someone knows more about all this and can help? sleep waits for me... :d

@te-online wow. so non of the possible format options that the new tar can create can be extracted on the server? this is user strange. something is really messed up. i can't debug because it works here fine.

i have the same problem and i hope it will be solved soon.

first, i had the problem that the available update to 5.0.13 under under admin page was not shown. i'm still using v5.0.10.

therefore i worked with this solution as described here:

https://github.com/owncloud/core/pull/5185/files

now, under admin page the new version 5.0.13 was shown. but if i go to update center the update fails.

checking your installation...
downloading package...
unable to fetch package
the update was unsuccessful. please report this issue to the owncloud community.
please fix this and retry.

log:
/tmp/94be6aa5430c..........c5f54d56b0.tar.bz2 extraction error
retrieving http://download.owncloud.org/community/owncloud-5.0.13.tar.bz2

is there now a solution for this?

well, my guess is (like @vicdeo said before) that it is related to the oc-archive script that can't extract the tar-file.
but unfortunately this only seems to happen on certain servers. as you can see it does work for @karlitschek (and others - because otherwise much more people would have complained, wouldn't they?).

now the question is what's wrong with our servers or what's wrong with the oc-archive script or what's additionally wrong with the tar.bz2-file from owncloud.org.

maybe some expert (don't know who) could investigate this? it took me hours only to find out the strange thing with long filenames working and short ones not (see above)... :-( because i'm neither used to work with tar, nor i wrote the php-script for extracting, which makes everything a little difficult ;-)

same problem here when upgtrading from 5.05 to 5.13.
allinkl.com webhoster.
might be related to restrictions for shared hosting? have shared hosting, too.

it's possible that shared hosters have some special limitations in php. there are 3rdparty patches for php and a lot of config and compile options that can influence that. very strange. @bantu do you know this from phpbb ?

@karlitschek for compressing and uncompressing archives, phpbb does have its own code. see https://github.com/phpbb/phpbb/blob/develop/phpbb/includes/functions_compress.php (legacy code still in use).

same problem here. i'm also running oc on shared hosting (hosteurope).
other updates (5.0.2->5.0.5->5.0.10->5.0.12) where running more or less ok for me.
5.0.12 -> 5.0.13 is the first to be causing this kind of tar.bz2 extraction error.

i really want to find out more about the problem, but i need your help.
in tar.php i see that there are errors stored in an error object when an error occurs. the class is based on pear.

so i found this http://pear.php.net/manual/en/core.pear.pear.seterrorhandling.php and tried that

```
$archive = \oc_archive::open('/path-to-owncloud/temp/ultitest.tar.bz2');
$archive->seterrorhandling( pear_error_print );
```

but this seems to be wrong and does not work (can't see any error but it exits there and error_reporting( e_all ) doesn't work either). how do i show errors?

i did lots of googling, but i seem to rely on your help!

it also worked for me for the last updates. taking a look at the change dates of the files, 3rdparty > tar.php wasn't changed for one year. this might not be the reason for problems.

is it possible that there is a problem with this file https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/lib/private/archive/tar.php oc-archive @deepdiver1975 changed 2 months ago?

it's somehow deserted here - everyone at the oc 6 release parties? :d

just wondering whether after a manual update to 5.0.13 the updater will offer me an update to oc 6? requires oc 6 a fresh install?
does anybody know? that could be a temporary solution for this problem, but: if the updater even after 5.0.13 manual update won't work correctly, i consider this as a serious problem!
i still don't have an explanation. sorry. which 3rdparty tar are your referring to by the way? can you post the complete url?
